meanings.definition: Duffest (adjective): superlative form of 'duff', meaning of poor quality or inferior.
meanings.sent1: The duffest cake I ever tasted was dry and bland.
meanings.sent2: This is the duffest movie I have seen all year.
meanings.sent3: The duffest excuse for being late was blaming it on a flat tire.
meanings.sent4: Her singing was the duffest note in the entire performance.
meanings.sent5: The duffest paint job on the car made it look like a child's art project.

meanings.definition: Duffest (adverb): in the poorest or most inferior manner.
meanings.sent1: She sang duffest of all the contestants in the competition.
meanings.sent2: He performed duffest in the class presentation.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick failed duffest when the rabbit refused to appear.
meanings.sent4: The team played duffest in the final minutes of the game.
meanings.sent5: The student answered the question duffest, causing confusion among the classmates.
